key.name: use-default-font
key.description: Whether to use the system’s default fixed width font for editing text instead of a font specific to gedit. If this option is turned off, then the font named in the “Editor Font” option will be used instead of the system font.

key.name: editor-font
key.description: A custom font that will be used for the editing area. This will only take effect if the “Use Default Font” option is turned off.

key.name: scheme
key.description: The ID of a GtkSourceView Style Scheme used to color the text.

key.name: create-backup-copy
key.description: Whether gedit should create backup copies for the files it saves.

key.name: auto-save
key.description: Whether gedit should automatically save modified files after a time interval. You can set the time interval with the “Autosave Interval” option.

key.name: auto-save-interval
key.description: Number of minutes after which gedit will automatically save modified files. This will only take effect if the “Autosave” option is turned on.

key.name: max-undo-actions
key.description: Maximum number of actions that gedit will be able to undo or redo. Use “-1” for unlimited number of actions.

key.name: wrap-mode
key.description: Specifies how to wrap long lines in the editing area. Use “none” for no wrapping, “word” for wrapping at word boundaries, and “char” for wrapping at individual character boundaries. Note that the values are case-sensitive, so make sure they appear exactly as mentioned here.

key.name: wrap-last-split-mode
key.summary: Last split mode choice for line wrapping mode
key.description: Specifies the last split mode used with line wrapping mode, so that when wrapping mode is off we still remember the split mode choice. Use “word” for wrapping at word boundaries, and “char” for wrapping at individual character boundaries.

key.name: tabs-size
key.description: Specifies the number of spaces that should be displayed instead of Tab characters.

key.name: insert-spaces
key.description: Whether gedit should insert spaces instead of tabs.

key.name: auto-indent
key.description: Whether gedit should enable automatic indentation.

key.name: display-line-numbers
key.description: Whether gedit should display line numbers in the editing area.

key.name: highlight-current-line
key.description: Whether gedit should highlight the current line.

key.name: bracket-matching
key.description: Whether gedit should highlight matching brackets.

key.name: display-right-margin
key.description: Whether gedit should display the right margin in the editing area.

key.name: right-margin-position
key.description: Specifies the position of the right margin.

key.name: display-overview-map
key.description: Whether gedit should display the overview map for the document.

key.name: background-pattern
key.description: Whether the document will get a background pattern painted.

key.name: smart-home-end
key.description: Specifies how the cursor moves when the HOME and END keys are pressed. Use “disabled” to always move at the start/end of the line, “after” to move to the start/end of the line the first time the keys are pressed and to the start/end of the text ignoring whitespaces the second time the keys are pressed, “before” to move to the start/end of the text before moving to the start/end of the line and “always” to always move to the start/end of the text instead of the start/end of the line.

key.name: restore-cursor-position
key.description: Whether gedit should restore the previous cursor position when a file is loaded.

key.name: syntax-highlighting
key.description: Whether gedit should enable syntax highlighting.

key.name: search-highlighting
key.description: Whether gedit should highlight all the occurrences of the searched text.

key.name: ensure-trailing-newline
key.description: Whether gedit will ensure that documents always end with a trailing newline.

key.name: toolbar-visible
key.description: Whether the toolbar should be visible in editing windows.

key.name: show-tabs-mode
key.description: Specifies when to show the notebook tabs. Use “never” to never show the tabs, “always” to always show the tabs, and “auto” to show the tabs only when there is more than one tab. Note that the values are case-sensitive, so make sure they appear exactly as mentioned here.

key.name: statusbar-visible
key.description: Whether the status bar at the bottom of editing windows should be visible.

key.name: side-panel-visible
key.description: Whether the side panel at the left of editing windows should be visible.

key.name: max-recents
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of recently opened files that will be displayed in the “Recent Files” submenu.

key.name: print-syntax-highlighting
key.description: Whether gedit should print syntax highlighting when printing documents.

key.name: print-header
key.description: Whether gedit should include a document header when printing documents.

key.name: print-wrap-mode
key.description: Specifies how to wrap long lines for printing. Use “none” for no wrapping, “word” for wrapping at word boundaries, and “char” for wrapping at individual character boundaries. Note that the values are case-sensitive, so make sure they appear exactly as mentioned here.

key.name: print-line-numbers
key.description: If this value is 0, then no line numbers will be inserted when printing a document. Otherwise, gedit will print line numbers every such number of lines.

key.name: print-font-body-pango
key.description: Specifies the font to use for a document’s body when printing documents.

key.name: print-font-header-pango
key.description: Specifies the font to use for page headers when printing a document. This will only take effect if the “Print Header” option is turned on.

key.name: print-font-numbers-pango
key.description: Specifies the font to use for line numbers when printing. This will only take effect if the “Print Line Numbers” option is non-zero.

key.name: margin-left
key.description: The left margin, in millimeters.

key.name: margin-top
key.description: The top margin, in millimeters.

key.name: margin-right
key.description: The right margin, in millimeters.

key.name: margin-bottom
key.description: The bottom margin, in millimeters.

key.name: candidate-encodings
key.description: List of candidate encodings shown in the Character Encoding menu in the open/save file chooser. “CURRENT” represents the current locale encoding. Only recognized encodings are used. The default value is the empty list, in which case gedit will choose good defaults depending on the country and language.

key.name: active-plugins
key.description: List of active plugins. It contains the “Location” of the active plugins. See the .gedit-plugin file for obtaining the “Location” of a given plugin.
